articles.title: Andy Murray secures his place in round two of the US Open after beating Francisco Cerundolo - Daily Mail
articles.description: The 35-year-old went into the tournament having only won one match on the North American hard courts this season and with concerns over persistent cramping but this proved to be a relatively straightforward outing.
articles.content:
Andy Murray made a positive start to his US Open campaign with a straight-sets victory over 24th seed Francisco Cerundolo in New York.

articles.title: FAU and Tel Aviv researchers receive grant to tackle Alzheimer’s-related mood disorders - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the most common type of dementia affecting an estimated 6.3 million Americans age 65 and older. Without the development of medical breakthroughs to prevent, treat, slow or cure AD that number could grow to 13.8 million by 2060.

articles.title: Biden administration blames Congress for imminent pause of free COVID tests program - CBS News
articles.description: Americans have until Sep. 2 to order their 16 free tests, if they haven't already.
articles.content:

articles.title: A mutated virus, anti-vaxxers and a vulnerable population: how polio returned to the US - The Guardian US
articles.description: In July, a young man in the New York are was diagnosed with polio – how did a disease America snuffed out in the 70s rebound?
